rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between Annotation and Body
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hasBody

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between Annotation and Target
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hasTarget

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a oa:SpecificResource and the resource that it is a more specific representation of.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hasSource

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The subject and object resources of the oa:equivalentTo relationship represent the same resource, but potentially have different metadata such as oa:serializedBy, oa:serializedAt and serialization format. oa:equivalentTo is a symmetrical and transitive relationship; if A oa:equivalentTo B, then it is also true that B oa:equivalent A; and that if B oa:equivalentTo C, then it is also true that A oa:equivalentTo C.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: equivalentTo

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The timestamp at which the Source resource should be interpreted for the Annotation.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: when

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The object of the relationship is the agent, likely software, responsible for generating the serialization of the Annotation's graph.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: serializedBy

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The time at which the Annotation was created created.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: annotatedAt

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a oa:SpecificResource and a oa:Selector.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hasSelector

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a oa:SpecificResource and a oa:State resource
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hasState

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a Specific Resource and the resource that provides the scope or context for it in this Annotation.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hasScope

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a oa:Annotation and a oa:Style
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: styledBy

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The string name of the class used in the CSS description that should be applied to the Specific Resource.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: annotatedAt

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The time at which the agent referenced by oa:serializedBy generated the first serialization of the Annotation, and any subsequent substantially different one.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: serializedAt

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A link to a copy of the Source resource's representation, appropriate for the Annotation.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: cachedSource

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The object of the relationship is a resource that identifies the agent responsible for creating the Annotation. This may be either a human or software agent.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: annotatedBy

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between an Annotation and a Motivation.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: motivatedBy

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The starting position of the segment of text. The first character in the full text is character position 0, and the character is included within the segment.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: start

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The end position of the segment of text. The last character is not included within the segment.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: end

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A copy of the text which is being selected, after normalization.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: exact

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A snippet of text that occurs immediately before the text which is being selected.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: prefix

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The snippet of text that occurs immediately after the text which is being selected.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: suffix

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a multiplicity construct node and its constituent resources.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: item

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The constituent resource of a oa:Choice to use as a default option, if there is no other means to determine which would be most appropriate.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: default

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A document identified by an HTTP URI that describes, at least, the Body and Target resources involved in the annotation.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Annotation

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A resource which identifies part of another resource, a particular representation of a resource, a resource with styling hints for renders, or any combination of these.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: SpecificResource

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A resource which describes how to retrieve an appropriate representation of the Source resource for the Annotation.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: State
TimeState
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A resource which describes how to retrieve a representation of the Source resource that is temporally appropriate for the Annotation.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: HttpRequestState
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A resource which describes how to retrieve an appropriate representation of the Source resource for the Annotation, based on the HTTP Request headers to send to the server.
A resource which describes the style in which the selection or resource should be rendered.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Style
CssStyle
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A resource which describes styles for resources participating in the Annotation using CSS.
A resource which describes the segment of interest in a representation of a Source resource
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Selector
FragmentSelector
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A resource which describes the segment of interest in a representation, through the use of the fragment identifier component of a URI.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: TextPositionSelector
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The class for a Selector which describes a range of text based on its start and end positions.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: TextQuoteSelector
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The class for a Selector that describes a textual segment by means of quoting it, plus passages before or after it.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DataPositionSelector
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The class for a Selector which describes a range of data based on its start and end positions within the byte stream.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: SvgSelector
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The class for a Selector which defines a shape using the SVG standard.
A class assigned to the Body when it is a tag, such as a embedded text string
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Tag

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A class assigned to the Body when it is a semantic tagging resource; a URI that identifies a concept, rather than an embedded string, frequently a term from a controlled vocabulary
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: SemanticTag

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The Motivation for an Annotation is a reason for its creation, and might include things like Replying to another annotation, Commenting on a resource, or Linking to a related resource.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Motivation

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A multiplicity construct that conveys to a consuming application that it should select one of the constituent resources to display to the user, and not render all of them.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Choice

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A multiplicity construct that conveys to a consuming application that all of the constituent resources are required for the Annotation to be correctly interpreted.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Composite

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A multiplicity construct that conveys to a consuming application that all of the constituent resources are required for the Annotation to be correctly interpreted, and in a particular order.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: List

skos:ConceptScheme.rdfs:comment: The concept scheme for Open Annotation Motivations

oa:Motivation.rdfs:comment: The motivation that represents a request for a modification or edit to the target resource.
The motivation that represents the assignment of a classification type, typically from a controlled vocabulary, to the target resource(s).
The motivation that represents a commentary about or review of the target resource(s).
The motivation that represents a description of the target resource(s), as opposed to a comment about them.
The motivation that represents the creation of a bookmark to the target resources or recorded point or points within one or more resources.
The motivation that represents a highlighted section of the target resource or segment.
The motivation that represents the assignment of an identity to the target resource(s).
The motivation that represents an assignment of value or quality to the target resource(s).
The motivation that represents asking a question about the target resource(s).
The motivation that represents a reply to a previous statement, either an Annotation or another resource.
The motivation that represents adding a Tag on the target resource(s).
